page.title: 19RELIGION IN WOLSTON
page.content: {Christianity}is the main religion though there are people with minority beliefs. Children learn about comparative religions. St. Margaret's Church and the Baptist Chapel provide the main buildings for worship, the former having a traditional male vicar and the latter having its{second woman {minister.}A C.E. church has stood on the same site for 900 years. The {Stewardship Campaign}begun in 1985 requires people to give their time, energy and a small amount of finance to help in promoting Christian attitudes in the Village. The Sunday School services the youngest children, the Quest group is for 10-14 year olds and there are Bible reading groups and prayer and praise meetings held in local homes. The{Baptist Chapel,}over 100 years old, still serves the needs of a small section of the community.
